news.title: GCCs, flex to drive office leasing to 85-90 million sq ft in FY27: India Ratings and ETRealty whitepaper
news.para: India's office market anticipates strong growth in FY27. Gross leasing is projected to increase by 12% to 14%. Global capability centers and flexible workspaces are driving demand. Supply additions remain disciplined. Rentals are expected to see moderate growth. This indicates a steady, quality-led expansion for the sector.

news.title: Residential sales growth to slow to 5-7% in FY27 amid high base: India Ratings and ETRealty whitepaper
news.para: India's housing market is set for slower growth in FY27 after a strong post-pandemic boom. Sales are expected to rise 5-7%, driven by premium and mid-market segments. Elevated prices and a high base will temper expansion. While demand remains positive, IT hiring slowdown poses a watchpoint for tech hubs. Developers focus on higher-value segments.

news.title: Civic bodies in distress as Hyderabad's property tax arrears cross ₹3,000 crore
news.para: Property tax arrears in Hyderabad's municipal corporations have surged past ₹3,000 crore, exceeding this year's collections and targets. With a one-time settlement offering a 90% interest waiver ending soon, dues could reach ₹5,000 crore. Commercial establishments and government buildings are major defaulters, impacting crucial development projects. Authorities are now threatening property attachment and auctions for non-payment.

news.title: Lucknow: IT City plot allotment via lottery on February 28
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority is launching its IT City housing scheme on Sultanpur Road on February 28. In the first phase, 870 developed plots will be allotted to 336 farmers through a lottery system as part of the land pooling policy. These plots, ranging from 35 to 288 sq m, will be free of cost for landowners.

news.title: In Faridabad village, plots carved out in protected Aravalis, on sale for ₹14,000 per sq yard
news.para: Despite Supreme Court orders to demolish illegal structures on protected Aravalis, construction continues in Anangpur, with plots openly sold near the ASI-protected Anangpur dam. Villagers report ongoing encroachments and electricity theft, highlighting inconsistent enforcement and a failure to protect the fragile ecosystem and historical sites.

news.title: Lucknow: RWA protests against sale of clubhouse by Emaar India
news.para: Residents of Emaar Gomti Green protested the alleged illegal sale of their clubhouse by Emaar India, which is now used for commercial activities, raising security concerns and disturbing peace. They also highlighted ongoing issues with electricity, water, and sewer systems, urging authorities for resolution and clubhouse handover.

news.title: More constructions to be brought under ambit of pollution monitoring system norms: Pune civic body
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation plans to mandate pollution monitoring systems for smaller construction projects, expanding current norms. Mayor Manjusha Nagpure announced that government and civic projects will also be required to monitor pollution levels, with ready-mix concrete plants to be included. This move aims to curb air pollution from construction activities across the city.

news.title: Bagmane REIT is said to seek $3.9 billion valuation in India IPO
news.para: Blackstone-backed Bagmane Prime Office REIT is gearing up for an upcoming IPO as it eyes a valuation close to $3.9 billion. Based in Bengaluru, the developer has obtained the necessary regulatory nod and is actively marketing the issue to institutional and retail investors.

news.title: Navi Mumbai civic body collect ₹650 crore property tax in FY26
news.para: Navi Mumbai Municipal Corporation has collected Rs 650 crore in property tax this financial year. A significant 62 percent of this amount, totaling Rs 383 crore, was paid through digital channels. The civic body is also taking strong action against property tax defaulters. Seizure actions have led to the recovery of Rs 39 crore.

news.title: ED attaches ₹598-crore worth of assets in case against Ansal Properties
news.para: The Enforcement Directorate has attached land valued at Rs 598 crore in Agra. This action is part of a money laundering investigation targeting Ansal Properties and Infrastructure Ltd. The case involves significant irregularities in land acquisition and release in Gurugram, Haryana. The agency alleges a fraudulent process led to land being released to private developers.

news.title: H-RERA orders Parsvnath Hessa Developers to compensate buyers for delay in Gurugram project
news.para: Haryana RERA has ordered Parsvnath Hessa Developers to pay over Rs 77 lakh to a couple for a delayed apartment on Golf Course Road. The developer failed to hand over possession of the flat in Parsvnath Exotica, which was due in 2015, and lacked an occupation certificate. The compensation covers loss of profit due to property value escalation.

news.title: REITs moving from niche to mainstream as capital deepens exposure to commercial real estate
news.para: At ET Realty Conclave 2026, the REIT ecosystem flags total-return expectations, a deep “REIT-ready” pipeline beyond offices, and the need for education, governance and valuation discipline as REIT participation broadens.

news.title: Affordable housing slump needs recalibration even as credit, infra push support growth: Niranjan Hiranandani
news.para: At ET Realty Conclave 2026, the NAREDCO Chairman outlines a strong macro runway for housing and commercial real estate, while cautioning that affordable housing slowdown and labour shortages demand urgent attention.

news.title: GCC-led demand, flex models may mark structural reset for India’s office market in 2026: Industry leaders
news.para: India's office market is undergoing a significant shift. Global Capability Centres are now innovation hubs, driving demand for quality spaces. Flexible workspaces are becoming a core strategy for businesses. Integrated business districts, offering a live-work-play environment, are also gaining importance. This evolution points towards an experience-driven phase for the Indian office sector.

news.title: Cluster redevelopment key to Mumbai’s future as greenfield land shrinks: Industry leaders
news.para: India’s next phase of urban growth will hinge on cluster-based redevelopment models, as underscored by speakers at the ET Realty Conclave 2026. With MHADA anchoring social inclusion, large-scale projects are increasingly drawing institutional capital. Stakeholders stressed that robust governance and transparent processes are essential, while stringent green norms and holistic community design will underpin long-term sustainability.

news.title: Infrastructure, discipline and micro-markets to shape the next housing cycle: Industry leaders at ETRECA 2026
news.para: Developers and industry stakeholders outline how rising costs, younger buyers, governance reforms and infrastructure expansion are redefining residential strategy for the next growth phase.

news.title: Haryana RERA orders Elan Buildcon to pay fixed returns, execute conveyance deed in Gurugram commercial unit case
news.para: H-RERA Gurugram has ordered Elan Buildcon to pay outstanding fixed returns to commercial unit allottees in 'Elan Miracle' and execute conveyance deeds within three months. The authority capped recovery for increased super area to 5% and mandated maintenance charges only from the offer of possession date.

news.title: India’s building materials market to reach $100 billion by 2030 on 10-12% CAGR: Avendus Capital
news.para: India's building materials market is set for significant growth, expected to reach nearly $100 billion by 2030. This expansion is fueled by a projected 10-12% annual growth rate over the next five years. Key segments like electrical goods, paints, tiles, and pipes are driving this surge. This growth reflects strong real estate, infrastructure, and consumption trends across the nation.
